channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lights out. Re occuring problem., 20th February
item.description:
The service rd lights between Rail Sidings Rd and Dockley Rd along with the walk through and stairwell to Lucey are not working AGAIN. This is a frequently re occuring problem that needs to be resolved once and for all. Although there is some lighting from the trading estate that partially illuminates the service rd, the walk through and stairwell between 72 and 74 Lucey way is dark and dangerous for vulnerable people. It also encourages the dumping of rubbish at the foot of the stairs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lucey Way, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enormous pot hole, 20th February
item.description:
URGENT Popped my car tyre 20/02 13:15 Single lane traffic due to temp lights & roadworks. No signage to inform of danger. Could not see cones on the approach. Cones are 1) not in the correct place 2) submerged 3) squashed on their side Witnessed other vehicles also suffering with damage.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whitewebbs Lane, Enfield
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 30 Grafton way on the road near the parking bay, 20th February
item.description:
This loose sunken manhole has been damaged loose and making a horrendous noise for nearly 4 months Grafton way has an extremely high level of traffic all day and night and the noise is driving me insane cars hit it every couple of seconds when I have been outside side monitoring it I can actually see the cover lift right up when cars drive over it we have very large heavy lorries use this road and it’s only a matter of time before this loose sunken manhole cover causes an accident

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Grafton Way, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole damaging vehicle and causing a hazard to traffic, 20th February
item.description:
This pothole has been present for months, this is a danger to both road users and pedestrians. Traffic swerving to avoid, disgraceful that the council hasn’t repaired this damage. They will be at risk of legal action if someone gets hurt given the previous reports from months ago yet no action taken by the council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Crown Dale, Upper Norwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside Kossoffs bakery, 20th February
item.description:
The button for the crossing is broken on one side of the street (Kossoffs side), so the traffic light does not change to allow pedestrians to cross. The button has been not working well for the last few weeks, but now it is not working at all.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 259, Kentish Town Road, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy drain cover, 20th February
item.description:
Drain cover rattling/clanking when driven over.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, North Cray Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Fouling, 20th February
item.description:
Piles of mess along Barnfield Road perpetrated by a "small" 50Kg brown and tan/ black Bully dog. Owner obviously aware as this is a preferred route and 3 separate piles of mess now in place. Passed him on route but wouldn't want to antagonise either party.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnfield Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Open big black bin with food in, 20th February
item.description:
My neighbour has left a giant black sack full of rubbish and food outside the front of our house. It is too large for me to lift and it won’t fit in the wheelie bin. Refuse collection is not for another week. It is starting to smell and I am worried it’s going to attract rodents. We have children here please can waste services come to collect. I have tried asking the neighbour to sort but they are not being helpful or reasonable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thayers Farm Road, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unroadworthy car, 20th February
item.description:
This car has been has been here for approximately 2 years, completely rusty, flat tyres and filled with rubbish also has foliage growing around it. Definitely cannot be driven

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Homefield Road, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Open/Damaged Cabinet Supply Box, 20th February
item.description:
There is a severely damaged and open utility cabinet located on the pavement directly opposite Mornington Crescent Station (near the junction with Crowndale Road). The door is hanging wide open, exposing a mass of internal wiring to the elements. There is some yellow tape on the unit, but it is no longer securing the door. This poses a trip hazard and a potential electrical risk to pedestrians, particularly given the wet weather. Please secure the unit as soon as possible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camden High Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Street Light - Equipment damaged, pole leaning

item.title: Fly tipping on side of road, 20th February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wyneham Road, Dulwich Village, Greater London

item.title: High Volume of Bikes parked dangerously., 20th February
item.description:
Lime E-bikes Parked Dangerously some are On pavement and Blocking road some are fallen over to the ground. A couple of bikes are blocking business entrances as well on Little Newport Street. Might hurt somebody.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Little Newport Street, Chinatown, City of Westminster

item.title: Dirty under bike rack, 20th February
item.description:
Under bike racks has mud / wee / faeces and is never cleaned. Disgusting to lock bikes there every day. Many bike racks have old bikes locked to them which are never removed. Needs fully cleaning / new bike racks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Green Road, West Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge quantity of rubbish along the Phantom Peak building, 20th February
item.description:
The rubbish might be on a private property. HOWEVER, the area is not fenced and it is visible from the public space. It is a complete disgrace that affects everyone walking on Canada street and especially local residents who shouldn't suffer this. As a local resident, there's not much I can do. So I'm asking my Councillor to solve this issue. Thank you P.S. There is also graffiti on the walls which must be removed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canada Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dark upright steel girder on left coming from shopping centre. Walked smack into it as lights not working. Scary. Also on the left corner by the river, the bricks are still uneven. The tree has been cut down the bricks are still not sorted. It’s very uneven and a Trip hazard. Thank you., 20th February
item.description:
See above. Please fix lights on this bit. It’s very scary Also the bricks on the path are still very uneven because of tree roots. The tree has been cut down for the pavement is still very uneven.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elder Walk, Ladywell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking bike stand on pavement, 20th February
item.description:
Could you arrange for removal of this pile of stuff which is starting to block the pavement, is attached to a bike stand and appears to be somebody’s personal storage area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gayhurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
